meanings.definition: To free from something unwanted or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: She ridded her room of old toys.
meanings.sent2: He ridded the garden of weeds.
meanings.sent3: The magician ridded the hat of a rabbit!
meanings.sent4: With determination, she ridded her mind of doubts.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight ridded the kingdom of the dragon menace.

meanings.sent1: They ridded the attic of dust and cobwebs.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers ridded the beach of litter.
meanings.sent3: The chef ridded the kitchen of all expired ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The storm ridded the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The detective ridded the crime scene of any evidence.

meanings.sent1: She ridded herself of bad habits.
meanings.sent2: He ridded his phone of unnecessary apps.
meanings.sent3: The cat ridded the house of mice.
meanings.sent4: The teacher ridded the classroom of distractions.
meanings.sent5: The doctor ridded the patient of the virus.
